Message.Title: Horrible...
Message.Msg: Balance sheet which Buffet seems incapable of deciphering. Rometti is following the Palmisano tactic of borrowing to increase the dividend and fund buybacks further increasing the negative net worth... their outsourcing strategy for margins is nearing the end of the runway..... soon it will be "cook the books time" just as we did during Akers last years before he was replaced by that great financial engineer.. Gerstner.. .. stock should enter a slow and long slide towards the latter half with Rometti busy buying shares to prevent the slide further exarcerbating a bad situation.. maybe she can persuade Buffet to join in and throw good money after bad.. and bring down Berkshire H as well..

Message.Title: playing the 207ish gap left from earnings
Message.Msg: The Bernank will come thru. THanks for all the cheap calls. Let's see..........
Give her some respect, at least learn how to spell her name right - Rometty. Then again, I guess you'd have to be able to spell your own name right first, doofus.

Topic.Title: Shorting IBM at 215 in March and covering at 197 AH was like taking a candy...

Message.Msg: Lot's of verbage, but no substance. BTW... 86% of people spell lose wrong, you're part of the statistical majority.

Message.Title: Love how they keeps trying to pump technology
Message.Msg: that everybody will be jumping on TECH yet TECH todays is one of the worst sectors Those iditos can't find a way out of the closet yet tell you where the market is going

I think you are being nice calling him doofus.. Just sitting here drinking... I was pondering, what IBM does with all that other money they earn???? Before this ER...They were reporting ttm, $14.50 per shr.. Hit that by 1.1B shrs!! That equates to a lot more money, than the $5B stk buy back and about $4B in dividends!! Lets at least, promote doofus to Dumb A!!!!!! As for Buffet and even Gates.. I have never considered them no more than people in the right place at the right time... Too become one of the richest people on the planet.... They took advantage of a lot of people.. Every time I see one of them... I would love to smack thier little smerks off thier faces!!! While everybody else considers them as geniuses.. I consider them as #$%$ of the earth, that have just took advantage of a lot of honest people!!!!! Now they are going to share all that money, which I consider they basically stole, with the rest of the world!!! Big deal!! What about the people they took advantage of?? That if treated fairly.. May be well off!! BTW: I ain't never invested in msft or berkshire....They didn't F me out of nothing!!! BTW: What the old farts tell you about life!!! They never told me when you turn 70.. Your deack falls off!!! I turned 70 in March.. Everybody can kiss my .............Just a little info for anyone turning 70!!!!

Message.Title: Long term holders of IBM should welcome a priced drop...
Message.Msg: The more the price goes down now, the more shares are retired in the share buyback program, Also, short term price drops are caused by 'weak hands' selling to 'strong hands'

Topic.Title: IBM might just be the ticker to monitor this year.
Long term holders of IBM should welcome a priced drop...

Message.Msg: So then AAPL was a buy at $705 and RIMM was an even better buy at $85.

Topic.Title: Shorting IBM at 215 in March and covering at 197 AH was like taking a candy...

Message.Msg: froznicehole: That's the key right there ... where you focus makes all the difference! If you make a mountain of a minor ant-typo, you are focusing as an English teacher and not on financial dynamics! And substance has to be there in reader's mind too, to pick-up on subtle signals. Otherwise, when I showed that post to my cat, she just said: "Meow" and moved on! LoL! :-)

Topic.Title: Long term holders of IBM should welcome a priced drop...

Message.Msg: So, according to you, IBM is just like AAPL? IBM is going to $700? Woohoo!

Topic.Title: Long term holders of IBM should welcome a priced drop...

Message.Msg: No. According to me IBM at $200 is just like AAPL at $705 or RIMM at $85. Both crashed.

Another good time to be worried was when the heir apparent to the CEO spot went to jail for insider trading. Then there were the charges of money laundering, fraud, and racketeering against 4 senior executives. Maybe IBM should pay a special tax to cover the cost of Justice Department investigations, prosecutions, and jail time for their most senior executives.
